channel.title: Projects on Vasuman
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Vasuman

item.title: File Sharing
item.author: varav@varav.in (Vasuman Ravichandran)
item.description: FiSh is a program that helps users share files simply and quickly over local networks that uses IP multicast for peer discovery. Written in Python. Uses Twisted and QT. Why? I realized that a lot of people were using pendrives a lot to transfer files between machines that were really close. I wanted a program with which I could simply host an ad-hoc network, have people connect to it and simply start sharing files.

item.title: Lindenmayer Systems
item.author: varav@varav.in (Vasuman Ravichandran)
item.description: A demo of the system described in this post. Refer to the source code for help. Simply enter the L-system grammar production rules, starting string and give the draw commands for each of the symbols in the grammar in a simple Logo-like language to generate beautiful patterns. Or, check out some of the presets. canvas#main-canvas { background-color: white; border: 1px solid black; max-width: 100%; height: auto; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; padding: 0.
